intro: Licaria exserta, commonly known as the Brazilian licorice or licorice tree, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and palmate leaves. The plant produces showy, pink to red flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its roots and bark contain compounds used in traditional medicine. Licaria exserta is often cultivated for its ornamental value and medicinal properties.
